Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all contracts have a general CC address for that contract where you can send funds into

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also, it is possible for any pubkey to have a CC address, this allows to have 2 forms of locked funds, one in the general fund spendable (under the right conditions) by anybody and a more restrictive one that can only be spent by pubkey's owner AND under the right conditions

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Alright I had a missing check against the sbits/txid for finding CC vins. fixing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: pushed fix. this should reject the onchain unlocks that violate the rule about needing to be from the same plan. that is the first test. then it needs to make sure it wasnt made too strict. it is a hardforking change so AT1 wont sync due to the rejection of the violating unlocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @dukeleto I think you need to handle the case of a null being returned. I think it is the test framework that is crashing due to unhandled null pointer coming back

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then again it could be a crash due to not having any coins at all, so you cant pay for the txfee

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: can someone make sure CC rpc doesnt coredump the komodod for a pubkey without any funds at all
